ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But how do you know? Perhaps he would be purified
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: What made you think that he will not grow in virtue,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: How could you know? Perhaps he would cleanse himself,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: You never know. Perhaps he wanted to purify himself,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And what do you know, he may be of the pure!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And how can you know that he might become pure
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And what would make you know that he would purify himself,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And what should teach thee? Perchance he would cleanse him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: What could inform thee but that he might grow (in grace)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: for how can you know that he might seek to purify himself,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: How canst thou know, whether haply he might be cleansed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And how do you know, maybe he would purify himself,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But what could tell thee but that perchance he might grow (in spiritual understanding)?-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But what could tell you that per chance he might become pure (from sins)?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And what could let you know? Perhaps he (comes to hear you) to be purified.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But how do you know? Perhaps he was seeking to purify himself.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But what would make you perceive, [O Muhammad], that perhaps he might be purified
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [80:3] And how would you know? Perhaps he would cleanse himself (yazzakkā: the original tā’ [of yatazakkā] has been assimilated with the zāy), that is, [perhaps] he would purge himself of sins by what he hears from you,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (What could inform thee) O Muhammad (but that he might) i.e. the blind man (grow (in grace)) became righteous through the admonitions of the Qur'an
